Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LC-AMP-F1 (LyeTx II; natural AMPs; Spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)

Literature.Author: Song Y, Wang J, Liu X, Yu S, Tang X, Tan H. 2024
Literature.Title: LC-AMP-F1 Derived from the Venom of the Wolf Spider Lycosa coelestis, Exhibits Antimicrobial and Antibiofilm Activities.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: Described in a review: Curr. Protein Pept. Sci. (2020, 21, 527â€“541). Found in multiple species.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (50%) tofrog Dahlein 5.1A=K: 21%; I=G: 16%. GRAVY: 0.574; mol Wt: 1942.407; mol formula: C91H160N24O22; mol ex coeff: 1490. It has the same aa sequence as  LyeTx II.Activity: E. coli (MIC 5-10 uM), S. dysenteriae (MIC 10 uM), S. typhimurium (MIC 5 uM), A. baumannii clinical (MIC 10 uM), P-vulgaris (MIC > 80 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 80 uM), Gram+ E. faecium 1359 (MIC 2.5 uM), S. aureus clinical (MIC 5 uM), S-aureus MRSA (MIC>80 uM).Toxicity: not hemo.lytic at 160 uM; Essentially not toxic to HEK293T, LO2, and 4T1 (cancer cells) at 20 uM.MOA:bacteria: Showed membrane permeabilization E. coli.Structure: became helical in 50% TFE. Est.Jan2024;
